questions.uddipok: Following is a bar diagram containing data on internet users of Bangladesh from 2014 to 2019. The numbers are in millions. Analyze the graph.

sub_questions.explanation: The bar graph illustrates the steady increase in the number of internet users in Bangladesh from 2014 to 2019. The graph shows that in 2014, there were around 40 million users, which increased to approximately 60 million by 2015. Then, the number of users suddenly decreased and reached 50 million in 2016. Only this particular year marks a decrease in the number of users. Then, a significant surge occurred in 2017 and the number of internet users jumped to 70 million. This marks an increase highlighting a rapid growth in internet accessibility and usage. The number of users remained same in 2018. Finally, in 2019, the number of internet users took another jump and turned into 80 million in total. Analysing the graph, we find that within five years, the number of internet users in Bangladesh increased significantly, making it double. It is a clear indication that during this period, the country's digital infrastructure improved significantly. It also shows that people of Bangladesh are. getting accustomed to the modern technologies.

questions.uddipok: Read the beginning of the following story and complete it in your own way. Give a title to it. Once, there was a king called Midas. He was very rich. Rich people are never satisfied. They want more and more. The more they have, the more they want. He thought, if he had the golden touch, he would be the happiest man.......

sub_questions.explanation:
King Midas and His Golden Touch
Once, there was a king called Midas. He was very rich. Rich people are never satisfied. They want more and more. The more they have, the more they want. He thought, if he had the golden touch, he would be the happiest man. A wise god granted his wish promptly. That afternoon, Midas was sitting near an apple tree in the palace orchard. A ripe apple fell from the tree in his front. He picked it up. It became gold. Midas realized that he had been gifted with a golden touch. He was overwhelmed with joy. He entered the palace with an ecstasy of joy. His little daughter, Marigold came running to her father. Midas took her up in his arms with an intensity of glee. But alas! There was a statue of gold in his lap. The princess was no more that Marigold. Now, he needed Marigold and not gold. He was shedding bitter tears. Suddenly, his face beamed up. He remembered the god. He prayed prayed to t him to take away the golden touch. The wise god heard the king's prayer and lifted from him the golden touch. Midas felt profoundly grateful. He took the princess again into the lap. She became Marigold once again. Then Midas' joy knew no bounds. He grew wiser and gave up his greed.'

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Mushfiq/Musfiqa and your friend is Sharif/Sharifa. Now, write a letter to your friend telling him/her what she/he intends to do after the HSC examination and why.

sub_questions.explanation:
Subject: My Post-HSC Plans
Dear Sharif,
Hope this letter finds you well.
I'm writing to share my plans for after the HSC exams. I've been giving it a lot of thought and I'm excited about the possibilities that lie ahead.
After completing my HSC, I intend to pursue a degree in Computer Science. I've always been fascinated by technology and the endless possibilities it offers. I believe that a degree in Computer Science will equip me with the necessary skills to contribute to the field and pursue a fulfilling career.
The rapid advancements in technology have made it an exciting and dynamic field to be a part of. I'm particularly interested in exploring areas like artificial intelligence, machine learning, and software development. I envision myself working on innovative projects that have a positive impact on society.
Furthermore, a degree in Computer Science opens up a wide range of career opportunities. I could work in software development, IT consulting, data analysis, or even research. The possibilities are endless, and I'm eager to explore them all.
I'm confident that pursuing a degree in Computer Science will be a rewarding and fulfilling journey. I'm excited to embark on this new chapter in my life and see where it takes me.
I'd love to hear about your plans for after the HSC. What are you thinking of doing?
Best regards,
Mushfiq
Rajshahi, Bangladesh

questions.uddipok:
Summarize the following text.
Many adolescents face pressure to use alcohol, cigarettes, or other drugs and to initiate sexual relationships putting
themselves at high risk for intentional and unintentłonal injuries, unintended pregnancies, and sexually transmitted infections (STIs), including the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV). Many also experience a wide range of adjustment and mental health problems. Behaviour patterns that are established during this period such as the use or avoidance of drugs and taking or abstaining from sexual risk can have long-lasting negative and positive effects on future health and well-being. As a result, adults have unique opportunities to influence adolescents. Adolescents are different both from young children and adults. Specifically, adolescents are not fully capable of understanding complex concepts, or the relationship between behaviour and consequences, or the degree of control they have or can have over health decision-making, including that related to sexual behaviour. This inability may make them particularly vulnerable to sexual exploitation and high-risk behaviours. Laws, customs, and practices may also affect adolescents differently than adults. For example, laws and policies often restrict adolescents' access to reproductive health information and services, especially when they are unmarried. In addition, even when services do exist, provider attitudes about adolescents often pose a significant barrier to the use of those services.

sub_questions.explanation: This passage highlights on the critical moments of adolescents, and the complexity and pressures they face during adolescence period. This phase is so critical since he/she has to face difficulties to adjust with them. They face life-destructing pressures and a wide range of mental and health problems. Also, this period is the shaper of his/her future with negative or positive effects. Adolescents are unable to perceive the complex concepts of life. Therefore, they become very vulnerable to high-risk behaviours and sexual exploitation. There are some restrictions and laws imposed on them to control or prevent them from going astray. As this phase is so critical for them, adults and other concerned authorities should be aware to guide them in the right direction.

questions.uddipok:
Write a summary of the passage in your own words:-

Kalpana Chawla's first space mission (Mission STS 87) began on 19 November 1997 with six other astronauts on the Space Shuttle Columbia. On her first mission that lasted for 15 days, 16 hours, 34 minutes and 4 seconds she travelled 6.5 million miles. She was responsible for deploying the Spartan Satellite which however malfunctioned, necessitating a spacewalk by Winston Scott and Tako Doi, two of her fellow astronauts, to retrieve the satellite. In 2000, she was selected for her second space mission STS 107. This mission was repeatedly delayed due to scheduling conflicts and technical problems. On 16 January 2003, Kalpana Chawla finally started her new mission with six other space crew on the ill-fated space shuttle Columbia. She was one of the mission specialists. Chawla's responsibilities included the microgravity experiments, for which the crew conducted nearly 80 experiments studying earth and space science, advanced technology development, and
astronaut health and safety.

sub_questions.explanation: Kalpana Chawla went on two space missions. In her first mission in 1997, she traveled 6.5 million miles and deployed a satellite. In 2003, on her second mission, she conducted nearly 80 experiments studying earth and space science, advanced technology development and astronaut health and safety. Regrettably, the tragic conclusion of her journey was marked by the unfortunate fate of the Columbia shuttle.

questions.uddipok:
Rearrange the following sentences to make a coherent order.
(a) At the age of 17, he went to Cambridge University, and after seven years there, he took MA degree.
(b) In May of 1638, Milton began a. 13-month tour of France and Italy.
(c) At the age of 66, he died on November 8, 1674.
(d) In 1640, Milton married, Mary Powell who died in 1652.
(e) John Milton was one of the famous poets of English literature.
(f) He finished composing this epic in 1664, and the epic was published three years later.
(g) He is best known for his epic poem, Paradise Lost, written in blank verse.
(h) In 1656, Milton later married Katherine Woodcock.
(i) After university, he abandoned his plans to join the priesthood and spent the next six years for a career as a poet.
(j) He was born in London on December 9, 1608 into a middle-class family.

sub_questions.explanation:
(e) →(j) →(a)→(i)→(b)→(d)→(h)→(g) → (f) → (c)
John Milton was one of the famous poets of English literature. He was born in London on December 9, 1608 into a -middle-class family. At the age of 17, he went to Cambridge University, and after seven years there, he took MA degree. After university, he abandoned his plans to join the priesthood and spent the next six years for a career as a poet. In May of 1638, Milton began a 13-month tour of France and Italy. In 1640, Milton married Mary Powell who died in 1652. In 1656, MIlton later married Katherine Woodcock. He is best known for his epic poem, Paradise Lost, written in blank verse. He finished composing this epic in 1664, and the epic was published three years later. At the
age of 66, he died on November 8, 1674.
